intro: Unifolium bifolium subsp. kamtschaticum, commonly known as the Kamtschaticum bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of the Russian Far East and northeastern Asia. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in forested or alpine habitats. The plant features a basal rosette of lanceolate leaves and produces tall, slender flowering stems with showy blue to violet flowers. Its botanical classification places it within the Campanulaceae family, known for its bell-shaped flowers. This subspecies is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its aesthetic appeal.
